title: Chongming District
text:
Chongming District () is northernmost district of the <a href="provinces%20of%20the%20People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">provincial</a>-level <a href="direct-controlled%20municipalities%20of%20China">municipality</a> of <a href="Shanghai">Shanghai</a>. Chongming consists of three low-lying inhabited <a href="alluvial%20island">alluvial island</a>s at the mouth of the <a href="Yangtze">Yangtze</a> north of the Shanghai peninsula: <a href="Chongming%20Island">Chongming</a>, <a href="Changxing%20Island%20%28Shanghai%29">Changxing</a>, and <a href="Hengsha%20Island">Hengsha</a>. Following its massive expansion in the 20th century, Chongming is now the 2nd-largest <a href="islands%20of%20China">island</a> administered by the <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">People's Republic of China</a> and the 2nd-largest in <a href="Greater%20China">Greater China</a>, after <a href="Hainan%20Island">Hainan</a>. Chongming does not, however, administer all of the island: owing to its continual expansion from sediment deposited by the Yangtze, it has merged with formerly separate islands and now includes <a href="Jiangsu">Jiangsu</a> <a href="provinces%20of%20the%20PRC">province</a>'s <a href="list%20of%20enclaves%20and%20exclaves%23Subnational%20pene-enclaves.2Fexclaves%20and%20inaccessible%20districts">pene-exclave</a> <a href="township%20%28PRC%29">township</a>s of <a href="Haiyong%20Township">Haiyong</a> and <a href="Qilong%20Township">Qilong</a>. Chongming proper covers an area of and had a population of at the time of the <a href="Sixth%20National%20Population%20Census%20of%20the%20People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">Sixth National Census in 2010</a>.
The <a href="county%20%28PRC%29">county</a> was established in 1396, the second year of the <a href="Ming%20Dynasty">Ming dynasty</a>'s <a href="Hongwu%20Emperor">Hongwu Emperor</a>. With the completion of the <a href="%23Transportation">Yangtze and Chongqi Bridges</a>, it is now connected to both the rest of Shanghai and southeastern <a href="Jiangsu">Jiangsu</a> <a href="provinces%20of%20the%20People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">province</a> along the <a href="G40%20Shanghai-Xi%27an%20Expressway">Hushan Expressway</a>. Further development is now proceeding according to an urban and agricultural master-plan led by <a href="Philip%20Enquist">Philip Enquist</a> of <a href="Skidmore%2C%20Owings%20%26amp%3B%20Merrill">SOM</a>, although ambitious plans for an <a href="ecocity">ecocity</a> named <a href="Dongtan%2C%20Shanghai">Dongtan</a> have been shelved since the 2006 ouster of <a href="Shanghai%20mayor">mayor</a> <a href="Chen%20Liangyu">Chen Liangyu</a> and other neighborhoods have swelled with immigration from people relocated from central China following the completion of the <a href="Three%20Gorges%20Dam">Three Gorges Dam</a>.
History.
Present-day Chongming first developed as two separate <a href="shoal">shoal</a>s—<a href="Xisha%20%28Yangtze%29">Xisha</a> and <a href="Dongsha%20%28Yangtze%29">Dongsha</a>—during the <a href="Wude%20Era">Wude Era</a> (AD 618–626) of the <a href="Tang%20dynasty">Tang dynasty</a>. By the first year of <a href="Shenlong%20Era">Shenlong</a> (705), a <a href="town%20%28PRC%29">town</a> was established on Xisha which was known as "Chongming". The number, size, and shapes of the islands fluctuated repeatedly over time and with the <a href="floods%20of%20the%20Yangtze%20River">flood</a>s of the <a href="Yangtze%20River">Yangtze River</a>. In the 15th year of <a href="Jiading%20Era">Jiading</a> (1222) under the <a href="Southern%20Song%20dynasty">Southern Song</a>, the islands were part of <a href="Tongzhou%20%28Jiangsu%29">Tongzhou Prefecture</a>. These early settlers were mostly <a href="fishing%20in%20China">fishermen</a> and <a href="salt%20in%20Chinese%20history">salt collectors</a>, with its principal <a href="saltern">saltern</a> at Tianci. In the 14th year of <a href="Zhiyuan%20Era%20%281264-1294%29">Zhiyuan</a> (1277) under <a href="Kublai%20Khan">Kublai Khan</a> of the <a href="Yuan%20dynasty">Yuan</a>, was organized within <a href="Yangzhou">Yangzhou</a>. Owing to the shifting sands of the islands, however, the <a href="district%20seat">district seat</a> needed to be repeatedly moved.
During the late Yuan and early <a href="Ming%20dynasty">Ming</a>, the sparsely-inhabited shoals of the area began to fill with migrants from <a href="Pudong">Pudong</a> and other areas of <a href="Songjiang%20Prefecture">Songjiang Prefecture</a>. These immigrants introduced <a href="cotton%20in%20China">cotton cultivation</a>, which spread widely prior to China's <a href="treaty%20ports">opening to international trade</a> in the later <a href="Qing%20dynasty">Qing</a>. There was small-scale <a href="textiles%20industry">textile production</a> in the area, but most was exported for use in <a href="Songjiang%20Town">Songjiang</a>, <a href="Hangzhou">Hangzhou</a>, and other more developed areas of <a href="Jiangnan">Jiangnan</a>. In the 2nd year of <a href="Hongwu%20Era">Hongwu</a> (1396) under the <a href="Ming%20dynasty">Ming</a>, the prefecture was elevated to a <a href="county%20%28PRC%29">county</a> but, shortly afterwards, a major subsidence provoked a mass emigration back to the mainland. This county was later placed in <a href="Suzhou%20Prefecture">Suzhou</a> and then <a href="Taicang%20Prefecture">Taicang Prefecture</a>s. The unification of over 30 <a href="shoal">shoal</a>s in 1681 was effectively the creation of the present-day <a href="Chongming%20Island">Chongming</a>, although it remained much smaller at the time.
Under the <a href="Republic%20of%20China%20%281912-1949%29">Republic</a>, the county was organized first under the <a href="Nantong%20Special%20Administrative%20District">Nantong</a> and then the <a href="Songjiang%20Special%20Administration%20District">Songjiang Special Administration District</a>. Nine years after the establishment of the <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">People's Republic of China</a>, it was placed under the <a href="municipality%20of%20Shanghai">municipality of Shanghai</a> in December 1958. <a href="land%20reclamation">Reclamation</a>, particularly large-scale work on the island's northern and eastern <a href="tidal%20flat">tidal flat</a>s in the 1960s and ’90s, doubled the size of Chongming between 1950 and 2010. <a href="Dongtan%2C%20Shanghai">Dongtan</a> was a proposed <a href="ecocity">ecocity</a> which was planned to open along with the <a href="2010%20World%20Expo">2010 World Expo</a> in Shanghai but stalled following the 2006 ouster of <a href="Shanghai%20mayor">Shanghai mayor</a> <a href="Chen%20Liangyu">Chen Liangyu</a>.
In mid-2016 Chongming was approved by the State Council of China to upgrade into a district of Shanghai; the District government was formally established in January 2017.
Landmarks and tour.
<a href="Dongping%20National%20Forest%20Park">Dongping National Forest Park</a> is located in the district, as are the <a href="Chongming%20Dongtan%20National%20Nature%20Reserve%20of%20Birds">Dongtan Nature Reserve</a>, the <a href="Chongxi%20Wetland%20Park">Chongxi Wetland Park</a>, and the <a href="Chongming%20National%20Geological%20Park">Chongming National Geological Park</a>. With its unspoiled environment, Chongming Island is one-of-a-kind destination great for eco-tours and restorative vacations. Chongming runs two 4A-class attractions and four 3A-class attractions. The tourism of the island focuses on three zones - East Chongming, Central Chongming and West Chongming. East Chongming features Dongtan Wetland Park and agritainment options in Yingdong Village and Nanjiang Village. Central Chongming features Dongping National Forest Park, agritainment options at Qianwei Village, Gaojia Zhuangyuan and Ruihua Orchard, Genbao Football Base, Chongming Xuegong (Chongming Museum), Jinaoshan Park, Shou’an Temple and Sanmin Cultural Village. West Chongming offers Mingzhu Lake Park, Xiling Resort, Xisha Wetland and agritainment at Lugang Village.
<a href="Town">Town</a>s.
The <a href="district%20seat">seat</a> and largest settlement of Chongming is the <a href="town%20%28PRC%29">town</a> of <a href="Chengqiao">Chengqiao</a> on <a href="Chongming%20Island">Chongming</a>. There are 227 <a href="village%20%28PRC%29">communities and villages</a> in the district, administered as 16 <a href="town%20%28PRC%29">towns</a> and 2 <a href="township%20%28PRC%29">townships</a>.
<a href="Changxing%20Island%20%28Shanghai%29">Changxing Island</a> is administered as a single town, also named <a href="Changxing%2C%20Shanghai">Changxing</a>. Other <a href="List%20of%20town-level%20divisions%20of%20Shanghai">town-level divisions</a> of Chongming include (from northwest to southeast): <a href="Xinhai%2C%20Shanghai">Xinhai</a>, <a href="L%C3%BChua">Lühua</a>, <a href="Sanxing%2C%20Shanghai">Sanxing</a>, <a href="Miao%2C%20Shanghai">Miao</a>, <a href="Dongping%2C%20Shanghai">Dongping</a>, <a href="Gangxi%2C%20Shanghai">Gangxi</a>, <a href="Jianshe%2C%20Shanghai">Jianshe</a>, <a href="Xinhe%2C%20Shanghai">Xinhe</a>, <a href="Shuxin">Shuxin</a>, <a href="Gangyan">Gangyan</a>, <a href="Bu%2C%20Shanghai">Bu</a>, <a href="Xianghua%2C%20Shanghai">Xianghua</a>, <a href="Zhongxing%2C%20Shanghai">Zhongxing</a>, <a href="Chenjia%2C%20Shanghai">Chenjia</a>.
<a href="Hengsha%20Island">Hengsha Island</a> is administered as a single <a href="township%20%28PRC%29">township</a>, also named <a href="Hengsha%20Township">Hengsha</a> and <a href="Xincun%20Township%2C%20Shanghai">Xincun</a>. The other <a href="List%20of%20township-level%20divisions%20of%20Shanghai">township-level division</a> of Chongming are Qianwei Farm, Dongping Forestry Zone, and Shangshixiandai Agricultural Park.
To its southeast along the northern shore is the township of <a href="Haiyong%20Township">Haiyong</a>; southeast of Haimen is <a href="Qilong%20Township">Qilong</a>. Both of these are <a href="list%20of%20enclaves%20and%20exclaves%23Subnational%20pene-enclaves.2Fexclaves%20and%20inaccessible%20districts">pene-exclave</a>s of <a href="Jiangsu">Jiangsu</a>; they are administered from <a href="Haimen">Haimen</a> and <a href="Qidong%20City">Qidong</a>, respectively.
Transportation.
Whereas the district was previously only connected to the mainland by <a href="ferry">ferry</a> service, the <a href="Shanghai%20Yangtze%20River%20Tunnel">Shanghai Yangtze River Tunnel</a> now connects Changxing Island with <a href="Pudong%20New%20Area">Pudong</a> in Shanghai, while the <a href="Shanghai%20Yangtze%20Bridge">Shanghai Yangtze Bridge</a> connects it with Chongming Island. Chongming is presently connected with <a href="Jiangsu">Jiangsu</a> by the <a href="Chongqi%20Bridge">Chongqi Bridge</a> and these three bridges and tunnels form part of the <a href="Hushan%20Expressway">Hushan Expressway</a> connecting northern Shanghai with <a href="Xi%27an">Xi'an</a> in central China. The <a href="Chonghai%20Bridge">Chonghai Bridge</a> connecting western Chongming with <a href="Haimen">Haimen</a> in <a href="Jiangsu">Jiangsu</a> is under construction.
Hengsha Island is connected via <a href="ferry">ferry</a>. 18 ferries continue to operate in the district. On Chongming, <a href="Chengqiao">Chengqiao</a>'s Nanmen Port offers service to <a href="Shidongkou">Shidongkou</a> and <a href="Baoyang%20Road%20Ferry%20Terminal">Baoyang Rd</a> in <a href="Baoshan%20District%2C%20Shanghai">Baoshan</a> and to <a href="Liuhegang">Liuhegang</a> in southern Jiangsu; <a href="Xinhai%2C%20Shanghai">Xinhai</a>'s Niupeng Harbor to <a href="Qinglonggang">Qinglonggang</a> in <a href="Haimen">Haimen</a>; and other ports offer connections with <a href="Wusong">Wusong</a> and the two other islands of the county.
The major arteries running along the length of Chongming Island are the Beiyan Highway on the north side and Chenhai Highway on the south. Another 38 <a href="highways%20in%20the%20People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">highways</a> cross the island. The main artery along the length of Changxing Island is the Panyuan Highway, while Fengle Road runs north and south across central Hengsha Island. There are 41 <a href="Buses%20in%20Shanghai">bus lines</a> in Chongming, connecting over 98% of its 227 communities.
<a href="Chongming%20line">Chongming Line</a> of the <a href="Shanghai%20Metro">Shanghai Metro</a> will link station on <a href="Line%209%2C%20Shanghai%20Metro">Line 9</a> in Pudong to Chongming via Changxing Island, with a branch from the latter to Hengsha Island. The line will use the Shanghai Yangtze River Tunnel and Bridge, which was built to take its tracks. The first phase of the line from to Changxing Island is scheduled to open by 2020.
Sports.
The <a href="Tour%20of%20Chongming%20Island">Tour of Chongming Island International Cycling Race</a> has been held on Chongming Island since 2007. It is held annually and includes a stage race and an <a href="UCI%20Women%27s%20Road%20World%20Cup">UCI Women's Road World Cup</a> race for elite women.
